Contradict fact: The claim that the photograph shows President Trump with "Millennial Matt" involved in the white nationalist march in Charlottesville contradicts the fact that the image was digitally manipulated and the original image was of a Bernie Sanders supporter at a Trump rally.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a manipulated image and there is no evidence linking "Millennial Matt" to the white nationalist march in Charlottesville.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph shows President Trump with "Millennial Matt" without verifying the authenticity of the image or investigating the background of "Millennial Matt" further.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the original image was of a Bernie Sanders supporter at a Trump rally, not "Millennial Matt" involved in the white nationalist march.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the connection between President Trump and "Millennial Matt" by falsely portraying them together in the manipulated image.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not thoroughly examining the evidence and relying on a manipulated image without proper verification.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
